edu.umd.cs.psl.application.topicmodel

Class LatentTopicNetworkMaxPseudoLikelihood

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.WeightLearningApplication
        • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.maxlikelihood.VotedPerceptron
          • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.topicmodel.LatentTopicNetworkMaxPseudoLikelihood
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelApplication

    public class LatentTopicNetworkMaxPseudoLikelihood
extends VotedPerceptron
    Learns weights by optimizing the pseudo-log-likelihood of the data. Modified version of MaxPseudoLikelihood which takes the LTN's log losses into account by importance sampling from the implied Dirichlet distribution.

        public static final java.lang.String BOOLEAN_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String NUM_SAMPLES_KEY

      • computeExpectedIncomp

        protected double[] computeExpectedIncomp()
        Computes the expected incompatibility using the pseudolikelihood. Uses Monte Carlo integration to approximate definite integrals, since they do not admit a closed-form antiderivative.
        Specified by:
        computeExpectedIncomp in class VotedPerceptron
        Returns:
        expected incompatibilities, ordered according to kernels
